column1: Russia: 'We're going to make sure that we're not going to spend money on things that are not in Ukraine'
The Russian Defense Ministry said the new sanctions against Ukraine will not affect the shipment of military equipment, even if the equipment is delivered to Russia.
We have agreed to keep our weapons in Ukraine, that we will take steps to ensure that Ukraine will not develop weapons systems that will be used for military purposes, the ministry said.
We have agreed to continue to strengthen cooperation with our European partners to ensure that we can avoid the risks of conflict and also avoid the risk of conflict with other EU states.
It said the new sanctions would not affect the shipment of military equipment, even if the equipment is delivered to Russia.
Ukraine's defence ministry said it was trying to convince Russia to give up on the weapons contracts after the Russian government seized control of Crimea in March.

We have agreed to continue to strengthen joint procurement with the European Union and to keep our weapons in Ukraine, that we will take steps to ensure that Ukraine will not develop weapons systems that will be used for military purposes, the ministry said.
Ukraine's defence ministry accused Russia of using its weapons stockpiles of Russian-made arms to support separatist factions.
Ukraine's National Security and Defense Council, which oversees the EU's arms program, said the new sanctions were not aimed at Moscow's use of weapons of mass destruction.

We have agreed to strengthen our cooperation with our European partners to ensure that Ukraine will not develop weapons systems that will be used for military purposes, said the council's president, Pavlo Klimov.
It said that the new sanctions would not affect the shipment of military equipment, even if the equipment is delivered to Russia.
We have agreed to continue to strengthen cooperation with our European partners to ensure that we can avoid the risks of conflict and also avoid the risk of conflict with other EU states.
The OSCE said the new measures are of "little-to-no concern" but would be "significant".
